intro: Armeria majellensis subsp. orphanidis, commonly known as the Canary Islands thrift, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh, coastal environments of its native habitat. It is often found in coastal grasslands and cliffs, where it withstands strong winds and salt spray. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
